description: A hiatal hernia is a condition in which the upper part of the stomach bulges through the diaphragm into the chest cavity.

attributes.name: Presence
attributes.description: Indicates whether the hiatal hernia is present or absent

attributes.name: Status
attributes.description: Indicates the status of the hiatal hernia

values.name: Unchanged
values.description: The hiatal hernia has not changed in size or characteristics

values.name: Enlarged
values.description: The hiatal hernia has increased in size

attributes.name: Size
attributes.description: Indicates the size of the hiatal hernia

values.name: Not specified
values.description: The size of the hiatal hernia is not specified

attributes.name: Intrathoracic herniation of stomach
attributes.description: Indicates whether there is intrathoracic herniation of the stomach

values.name: Present
values.description: Intrathoracic herniation of the stomach is present

values.name: Absent
values.description: Intrathoracic herniation of the stomach is absent

attributes.name: Esophageal fluid
attributes.description: Indicates whether there is esophageal fluid

attributes.name: Esophageal wall thickening
attributes.description: Indicates whether there is esophageal wall thickening

attributes.name: Tree-in-bud opacities
attributes.description: Indicates whether there are tree-in-bud opacities
